captions.text: Which one do you want to be?

I prefer to be Ruth,
but I can be flexible.
What do you need?
Alcohol.
So, are you okay with wine?
I don't know.
Well, you choose the wine.

I'll go find the bedroom
and slip into
something more Ruth.

I'm Ruth-less at the moment.
We really should go.
I've got to catch my ride.
So go.

I did. I thought
maybe you were a nut.
But you were exciting.
I wish you'd stayed.

I wish I'd stayed, too.
Now I wish I'd stayed.
I wish I'd done a lot of things.
I wish I'd stayed. I do.

I came back downstairs
and you were gone.

I walked out the door.
Why?

I don't know. I felt
like a scared little kid.
It was above my head.

You were scared?
Yeah.
I thought you knew that about me.

I ran back
to the bonfire, trying
to outrun my humiliation.

Was it something I said?
Yeah.

You said "So go"
with such disdain.
I'm sorry.
It's okay.
What if you stayed this time?
I walked out the door.
There's no memory left.
Come back and make up a goodbye.
Let's pretend we had one.
Bye, Joel.
I love you.
Meet me in Montauk.

title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind (8/11) Movie CLIP - Meet Me in Montauk (2004) HD

comments.author: Seth “CanterburyCam” Canterbury

comments.text:
This movie always kind of reminded me of an elderly, sappy, grown-up Scott 
Pilgrim x Ramona movie. The hair and spontaneous nature of clem, the 
dorkiness of joel, the obscurity. Like they've aged fifteen years and moved 
down to New York.﻿
comments.author: Timespentstill

comments.text:
I want a sequel so badly. I want to see what happens when they fall back in 
love and try desperately to get it right this time, grasping at straws to 
impossibly remember their good and bad times.﻿

This is the only time he says "I love you," in the whole film.

It's a beautiful moment. ﻿

comments.text:
Oh happy state! when souls each other draw, When love is liberty, and 
nature, law: All then is full, possessing, and possess'd, No craving void 
left aching in the breast: Ev'n thought meets thought, ere from the lips it 
part, And each warm wish springs mutual from the heart. This sure is bliss 
(if bliss on earth there be) And once the lot of Abelard and me.

comments.author: Gabby Marie

comments.text:
It's the idea that puts a lump in my throat: Even if there were a way to 
systematically delete someone from your mind, your subconscious (the 
associative, illogical, and resilient aspect of human nature) would get 
around it. You'd still gravitate to where you could meet that person and 
still feel an inexplicable vestigial bond with this person, as if you've 
known each other, and the conversation you're having is more of a rewording 
and rearranging of an experience you've both already shared.
comments.author: Trilce

comments.text:
The same thing happened to me. I pulled up home and sat in my car for 15 
minutes mind racing and eyes streaming. It will forever hold a special 
place in my heart for that.

comments.text:
Hm, Winslet's role definitely belongs to the leading category . This year 
(2005) the Academy chose to honor a very classic film "Million Dollar 
Baby". But they should at least have let room for nominations for Eternal 
Sunshine. They nominated Finding Neverland instead.. they chose the wrong 
Kate Winslet's Movie! The movie was good but not as deep, creative and 
beautiful as Eternal Sunshine. The Academy always get things wrong. But one 
sure thing: this film is already cult.

comments.text:
I can't watch this scene without crying. I watched this movie at a time 
when my boyfriend left me, feeling like I was never loved in the first 
place. I tried to talk to him but he never replied or didn't pick up my 
calls. We still haven't had a proper goodbye and the conversation they have 
especially when Joel says "I wish I had stayed" and when they say "Bye 
Joel" "I love you" gets to me. I don't know if I'll ever see him again, I 
miss him so much.
comments.author: Cacolyte Aguilar
